Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r a small bit of Git advice: in your staked fork of KMD, i would keep all of James' branch names alone, such as FSM, and leave them as exact copies of upstream. Use your own branch name that is unique to this project. Then, when pulling in new changes from James, your life will be less complex.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if your FSM is already different, it's not hard to just change the branch name and then put FSM back to it's upstream state. Then you can do diffs against James's upstream and your current tip, more easily

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but I want the PoS fix?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: my suggestion is for the case of: "I merged some stuff into our FSM, but not others, and now it's a nightmare to tell what is only in upstream and what is in our branch/fork"

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this isnnt about $ for me ... i dont think I need to say that again

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and also will make cherry-picking commits easier, potentially

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you mkssing te pooint

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am just giving general Git advice to make your life easier, I am not saying it fixes the particular issue you have right now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: having an FSM with all your changes mixed with all upstream, and then trying to pull in more, well, you now know how painful that is
